Bag O' Links - 7/9/2009

07 Sep 2009

  • The ultimate Rails stack on Snow Leopard – ok, cool… but why SQL server?
  • Another Snow Leopard development stack checklist – this time, no SQL server.
  • …and one with Ruby 1.9.1 and RVM
  • 40 javsacript plugins – it’s raining plugins.
  • Keep models out of your views – Glenn hops on some MVC issues with rails, positively of course.
  • Raphael RC 1.0 – This is one javascript library i can’t wait to use.
  • Check there is something to deploy – awesome tip by Matt Darby
  • Rails Caching and Javascript Techniques – Working around caching issues with Javascrtipt.
  • Rails security updates – right here.
  • Table manipulation with jQuery – awesome list of plugins.
  • HTML 5 visual cheat sheet – win.
  • Planting the Seed – Red Robby on data seeding.
  • Snakes on Web – a web developer’s rant.
  • The future of Databases – a quick overview on the future of SQL based databases…if that is, indeed the future :)
  • API scalability with caching – oh yeah, that’s the good stuff.
  • Making HTML SELECTs printable – i would consider printing the selected value only thu.
  • That’s not a leak, that’s a bloat! – engineYard tackle ActiveRecord.
  • Codaset – a GitHub competitor, currently on beta.. ping me for an invite.
  • Basic rails development with source control guide – Fear of fish explains git practices for the young ones.
  • iPhone development Resources – can’t say i like it, but it’s where the money at ATM.

GitHub Treasures

  • OpenID for Rails – Maybe one day, when i will like OpenID.
  • oAuth-plugin – implement oAuth in your rails application (who said API?)
  • deamon-generator – Generate deamons in rails.
  • PDFly – a thin rails app that wraps the FlyingSaucer pdf-library into a JSON/REST api
  • FamFamFam icons – some helpers/icons for the heck of it.
